runs.comm: a slower ball to start, outside off stump, and through to the keeper
good sharp length, jagging into the splice. Defended to the gully
quick and jagging. Lovely bowling, outside off, nipping off the moist deck, and Marsh is well beaten
full length, and swished chancily into the leg-side. Marsh gets enough bat on it to clear the infield, and he's off the mark
more sharp movement, zipping into the left-hander, and Taylor nods approvingly in his followthrough
down the legside, well gathered, but that's an easy call for the umpire
in the slot, and thumped majestically down the ground for a maximum. Cracking stroke. He looked all at sea for much of that over, but he's still taken it for nine runs
good length to start, on off stump and pushed into the covers
lovely bite and bounce, Benn uses his height well, and Ramdin half appeals for a stumping
tweaking past off stump again, excellent bounce and Ramdin leaps as he takes
clipped into the leg side, and Ronchi's off the mark
walloped into the covers, and that was technically a chance. But it was actually three runs saved. Bravo got his fingertips to it, goalkeeper style, brave effort
good end to a tight and tidy over
incredible shot! He backed away, hung his bat out as if he was a scared tailender, and yet timed it so sweetly that it flew all the way over backward point! Remarkable
inside-out clobber over the covers. Dramatic striking, and the runs are flowing
opens the shoulders, and strikes through the line like a golfer. Didn't come off the middle of the bat, but a one-bounce four will do nicely
slower ball, yorker length, big appeal, but just drifting down. Good riposte
short and climbing off the pitch, Ronchi attempted to steer that over third man, but didn't make contact. For once
another slower ball, and that's an excellent comeback. Ronchi swings into a slog sweep, but the ball is through to the keeper
full toss, and that's a bit of a let-off. Marsh can't time his slog, and midwicket fields
down the leg side
smacked in the air, over mid-off, who can't quite reach as he leaps. It looks as though Bravo is unaware that the Powerplays are over
cut, and cut hard, whistles through point
driven hard and straight, Benn gets a finger on the ball, but still a single
shovelled into the covers
down on one knee, and slapped violently through midwicket. West Indies' field placings are all at sea, and Australia are taking ruthless advantage
full toss, outside off stump. Not a bad delivery in the circumstances
swished out to deep midwicket, and a cheeky second run as Pollard's throw goes wide
driven firm and straight, Perkins the debutant fields at long-on
full length and inswinging, a massive mow from Ronchi, but no connection
Ronchi backed away, so Edwards followed him, good bowling
fast and straight, defended into the covers for a single. Good over
beamer! And a nasty one too. Marsh swings in self-defence, and the ball flies down to third man off his gloves
dropped - superb bounce and carry, Ronchi fended it through to the keeper, who muffed the chance. It is getting very dark
pummelled down the ground
too much width, and slashed past backward point. Ronchi gave himself room, but reached it well in the end
had to scamper as the throw came in from the covers, but safely home
excellent slower ball, just kept out at the last minute
in the slot and slapped down the ground, but not enough bat on it, and the home boy has a debut wicket!
clipped off the pads
short and on the pads, Benn at short backward point fields well, but winds himself in the process
full toss, clobbered over cover, and picked up in the deep
attempted yorker, a hint of inswing, and swished out to midwicket
slower-ball bouncer. Quite a cunning plan, that one
in the slot and mowed across the line. Deep midwicket can't cut that off
very decent pace, outside off stump, and Watson is beaten
a touch too straight, but Watson misses out with a leg-side flick
smashed back down the ground, and Roach instinctively sticks out a mitt, and saves four runs
that's vast - clean as a whistle over long-on. TImed to perfection and that carries 98 metres, apparently

what a catch! That was short and swung out to deep midwicket. Marshall, running towards the rope, leaps, takes cleanly, then tiptoes along the boundary rope, just inches inside. He keeps his balance and that's a key breakthrough
tucked behind square
slower ball from the skipper. Well bowled
another slower ball, and Hussey is onto that far too quickly. A spiralling top-edge and Perkins at midwicket judges it well
flicked straight to square leg, thoughts about a single, but the throw comes in to persuade him otherwise
angled into the blockhole from around the wicket. Driven down the ground
an agonisingly slow slower ball, eventually cut behind square
aiming for the blockhole again, but swung lustily into the gap at deep midwicket, where it neatly bissects two fielders
floated onto a good length, White opens his shoulders for the drive, but can't time it as the ball plugs in front of long-off
low full toss, shovelled out to midwicket
not a bad ball at all, slow and full, but White gets under it and times it to perfection, inside-out, over cover
flogged with even more power into the covers, but picked up by the sweeper
bouncer, and a good one too. Close to a wide, but well directed
not such a good bouncer. Short again, and Watson was waiting this time. Sweet connection, into the Hall and Griffiths stand at midwicket
low full toss, clipped out to midwicket, a tight call for the second run, but they make it comfortably in the end
outside leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
a pre-meditated paddle-sweep, so Bravo bounces it over his shoulder. Good bowling
a swing and a miss. Quite possibly the first of the innings
slower ball again, swatted back down the ground, and long-on fields
Watson wound himself up for the big strike, but succeeds only in whisking the ball round the corner for one more run
